Package com.example

Class GradleProject

java.lang.Object
com.example.GradleProject
public class GradleProject
extends java.lang.Object
Represents a Gradle Project connected using the Gradle Tooling API dependency Can be used to run tests on an external gradle project, build it, list the tasks and/or run any task from it

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    GradleProject​(java.io.File projectRootDirectory)
    Make a GradleProject from the file of the project's root directory
    GradleProject​(java.lang.String projectRootPath)
    Make a GradleProject from the path of the project's root directory

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean buildProject​(java.io.OutputStream logs)
    Tries to run the 'build' task on the Gradle project.
    void close()
    Closes the connection to the project and cleans up memory
    GradleProject link()
    Connects to the project and tries to get the model to ensure connection has been established
    boolean linked()
    Returns the (assumed) connection state of the project
    java.util.List<? extends org.gradle.tooling.model.GradleTask> listTasks()
    Lists all the tasks defined in the gradle project.
    boolean runTasks​(java.io.OutputStream logs, org.gradle.tooling.model.GradleTask... tasks)
    Tries to run all the tasks containing given in the vararg parameter
    boolean testProject​(java.io.OutputStream logs)
    Tries to run all the tasks containing 'test' in their name on the Gradle project.

      Make a GradleProject from the path of the project's root directory
      Parameters:
      projectRootPath - file path to the root directory of the gradle project
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the path doesn't exist or is not a directory

      public GradleProject​(java.io.File projectRootDirectory) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Make a GradleProject from the file of the project's root directory
      Parameters:
      projectRootDirectory - File object to the root directory of the gradle project
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the file doesn't exist or is not a directory

  • Method Details

    • link

      public GradleProject link() throws org.gradle.tooling.GradleConnectionException
      Connects to the project and tries to get the model to ensure connection has been established
      Returns:
      this
      Throws:
      org.gradle.tooling.GradleConnectionException - if the directory doesn't point to a valid Gradle Project

    • linked

      public boolean linked()
      Returns the (assumed) connection state of the project
      Returns:
      true if the project has been successfully linked

    • close

      public void close()
      Closes the connection to the project and cleans up memory

    • buildProject

      public boolean buildProject​(java.io.OutputStream logs) throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
      Tries to run the 'build' task on the Gradle project. First lists the available tasks, picks the first one called 'build' and tries to run it
      Parameters:
      logs - output stream to redirect the logs to (use ByteArrayOutputStream to get a String)
      Returns:
      true if the build has been (seemingly) successful
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the project has not been linked yet
      See Also:
      to link the project before using this, used to listing the available tasks, used to run the 'build' task, for String logs output

    • testProject

      public boolean testProject​(java.io.OutputStream logs) throws java.lang.IllegalStateException, org.gradle.tooling.GradleConnectionException
      Tries to run all the tasks containing 'test' in their name on the Gradle project. First lists the available tasks, filters out the tasks without 'test' in the name, and run all of them. Checks whether the Exception message looks like a "no tests are defined on the project" message when a TestExecutionException is caught.
      Parameters:
      logs - output stream to redirect the logs to (use ByteArrayOutputStream to get a String)
      Returns:
      true if the tests tasks have been (seemingly) successful or if none were found
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the project has not been linked yet
      org.gradle.tooling.GradleConnectionException
      See Also:
      to link the project before using this, used to listing the available tasks, used to run the testing tasks, for String logs output

    • runTasks

      public boolean runTasks​(java.io.OutputStream logs, org.gradle.tooling.model.GradleTask... tasks) throws java.lang.IllegalStateException, org.gradle.tooling.GradleConnectionException
      Tries to run all the tasks containing given in the vararg parameter
      Parameters:
      logs - output stream to redirect the logs to (use ByteArrayOutputStream to get a String)
      tasks - tasks to runs
      Returns:
      true if the tasks have been (seemingly) successful
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the project has not been linked yet
      org.gradle.tooling.GradleConnectionException
      See Also:
      to link the project before using this, to find tasks on a project, to find tasks on a project, GradleTask, for String logs output

    • listTasks

      public java.util.List<? extends org.gradle.tooling.model.GradleTask> listTasks() throws java.lang.IllegalStateException, org.gradle.tooling.GradleConnectionException
      Lists all the tasks defined in the gradle project.
      Returns:
      list containing all the defined tasks on the project
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the project has not been linked yet
      org.gradle.tooling.GradleConnectionException
      See Also:
      to link the project before using this, to find tasks on a project, GradleTask
